page.title: 02Old Fritchley School
page.content: In 1870 Fritchley C of E Primary School was opened. Miss Susanah Rogers was the first headteacher. She kept a daily record of work in the log book which is very interesting reading. In 1897 it is recorded that the school was closed by the Authority due to a whooping cough epidemic and reopened in February, only to be closed again and not reopened until 22nd March. In June 1910 a rather interesting entry appears showing that Fritchley children in 1910 were no different to Fritchley children in 1985. It states "owing to complaints of a tenant of the field adjoining the school premises I have been compelled to ask boys to cease playing football in the playground". On May 24th 1906 Empire day was celebrated for the first time. Inspectors came every year to inspect the children and give a report.
